intro: Pavetta longibrachiata, commonly known as the long-branched pavetta, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important species such as coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or pink flowers that bloom in the summer. Its fruits are capsules that release tiny seeds when mature. Pavetta longibrachiata is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
